alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 10:06AM CST until January 29 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 51.5 feet, Moderate lowland flooding continues with up to one foot of water is over the road at the intersection of Bellau Wodd and Riviera and many homes in the Northshore subdivision are cutoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 48.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 51.7 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 51.7 feet on 06/27/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 48.5 Wed 9 am CST 50.4 51.6 51.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM CST.
